docs.abstract: In 1992, Héctor Tobar was a young reporter at The Los Angeles Times when the city erupted in violence. What really happened — and what didn’t?
docs.snippet: In 1992, Héctor Tobar was a young reporter at The Los Angeles Times when the city erupted in violence. What really happened — and what didn’t?
docs.lead_paragraph: In the spring of 1991, I was in the Los Angeles Times newsroom when word came that a local Black motorist named Rodney King had been nearly beaten to death by the police. Despite the fact that our staff had been writing about sensational cases of police brutality for years, the crisis set off by the videotape of King’s being assaulted seemed to catch us by surprise.

headline.main: The L.A. Riots Were 30 Years Ago. I’m Still Trying to Understand Them.

docs.abstract: Studios are signing up consultants to help make sure their movies or shows don’t raise any cultural red flags.
docs.snippet: Studios are signing up consultants to help make sure their movies or shows don’t raise any cultural red flags.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 2020, not long after the murder of George Floyd spurred a racial reckoning in America, Carri Twigg’s phone kept ringing.

headline.main: Helping Hollywood Avoid Claims of Bias Is Now a Growing Business
headline.print_headline: Tackling Hollywood Bias,  A Single Script at a Time

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Coalition of Asian Pacifics in Entertainment (CAPE)

keywords.value: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation

docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors accused Kenneth Pilon, 61, of attempting to intimidate Black Lives Matter supporters with threats in the summer of 2020.
docs.snippet: Federal prosecutors accused Kenneth Pilon, 61, of attempting to intimidate Black Lives Matter supporters with threats in the summer of 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Michigan man accused of attempting to intimidate Black Lives Matter supporters by leaving nooses and threatening notes in his community and making racist threats in phone calls has been charged with hate crimes, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Man Charged With Hate Crimes After Nooses and Racist Notes Found

docs.abstract: Videos of Erin Maye Quade’s speech ricocheted across the internet, with critics saying the process should have been suspended.
docs.snippet: Videos of Erin Maye Quade’s speech ricocheted across the internet, with critics saying the process should have been suspended.
docs.lead_paragraph: The pause, three minutes into a candidate’s speech about the toll of climate change, the pandemic and the murder of George Floyd, was not just for rhetorical effect.

headline.main: A Minnesota candidate was in labor during her convention speech. The proceedings went on.
